'''Sasha McVeigh''' is a British [[country music]] singer-songwriter from [[Hereford]], United Kingdom. Upon completing high school in 2012, she began pursuing a career in the country industry.<ref name=":0" /> In 2017, McVeigh moved to [[Nashville, Tennessee]] after obtaining her green card.

==Music career==
McVeigh began performing professionally in July 2012 after graduating [[Hereford Sixth Form College]]. She graduated with four A-levels and five university offers, but instead chose to go to Nashville and pursue a career in country music.<ref name=":0">{{cite web |url=http://www.successcircuit.com/interviews/sasha-mcveigh-british-country-singer/ |title=Sasha McVeigh – British Country Singer |work=Success Circuit |access-date=7 June 2023 |archive-date=10 April 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160410111700/http://www.successcircuit.com/interviews/sasha-mcveigh-british-country-singer/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name="bio"/>

McVeigh has played on the main stage at numerous festivals in the UK and USA, and named UK Country Radio Awards "Female Vocalist of the Year" in 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.c2c-countrytocountry.com/line-up/sasha-mcveigh|title=C2C|website=C2c-countrytocountry.com|access-date=16 August 2017|archive-date=16 August 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170816152844/http://www.c2c-countrytocountry.com/line-up/sasha-mcveigh|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ukcountrymusicawards.com/winners.shtml|title=past award winners|website=Ukcountrymusicawards.com|access-date=15 August 2017|archive-date=15 August 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170815162948/http://www.ukcountrymusicawards.com/winners.shtml|url-status=live}}</ref> She has embarked on co-headline tours with American artists [[Sonia Leigh]] and [[American Young]] in the UK, as well as embarking on her own headline tours and opening for acts such as [[Dustin Lynch]], [[Luke Bryan]] and [[Keith Urban]] in the US.<ref name="bio" />

In 2016, McVeigh released a her single ''When I'm Over You'', which had been recorded in Nashville in November 2015. The song was debuted by [[Bob Harris (radio)|Bob Harris]] on his [[BBC Radio 2]] show and was added to the Wild Country Playlist on Spotify, subsequently amassing over 500,000 streams in the first three weeks. The video premiered on the boot in July 2016.<ref name="bio">{{cite web|url=http://www.sashamcveighmusic.com/bio|title=Bio|website=Sashamcveighmusic.com|access-date=22 July 2017|archive-date=16 August 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170816061556/http://www.sashamcveighmusic.com/bio|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://theboot.com/sasha-mcveigh-when-im-over-you-music-video/|title=video premiere|website=Theboot.com|access-date=16 August 2017|archive-date=16 August 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170816153132/http://theboot.com/sasha-mcveigh-when-im-over-you-music-video/|url-status=live}}</ref>
